questions.question: Why were many Native American tribes interested in aligning with the French during the French and Indian War?

choices.answer: The French promised to return stolen land to Native Americans.
The French and Natives had a profitable trade network
The Natives and French spoke the same language
The French didn't settle on native lands in large numbers

questions.question: When and where did the French and Indian War begin?

choices.answer: The war started in 1776 in New England.
The war started in 1754 in New England.
The war started in 1754 in the Ohio River Valley.
The war started in 1776 in Canada

questions.question: The French and Indian War was was fought between the

choices.answer: French and the Indians
Indians and the Spanish
French and British against the Indians
The French and Indians against the British and the colonists.

questions.question: What was the main cause of the French and Indian War?

choices.answer: The French and British claimed the same land.
The French and Indians claimed the same land.
The Indians wouldn't sell their land.
The French, British and natives all claimed the same land

questions.question: Who was the young military leader from Virginia who fought in the French and Indian war?

choices.answer: William Pitt
George Washington
King George II
Edward Braddock

questions.question: How was the land divided after the war ended?

choices.answer: Britain got everything East of the Mississippi River
The Native Americans got half and Britain got half.
Britain got America and France got Canada
The natives got their land back

questions.question: What did the Proclamation of 1763 say?

choices.answer: France owned the land west of the Appalachian Mountains
Colonists could not move west of the Appalachian Mountains
Natives owned the land west of the Appalachian Mountains
Colonists could move west of the Appalachian Mountains

questions.question: What was a cause of the Proclamation of 1763?

choices.answer: Britain decided it was too expensive to protect colonists in Ohio
The King wanted to control his settlers so he made this Proclamation.
The Native Americans were asking for more money.
The King was bored and wanted to make a new law.

questions.question: Why were many colonists angry about the Proclamation of 1763?

choices.answer: They wanted their money back for the land.
They wanted to travel all the way west to California.
They were unhappy because they could not settle on new lands.
They wanted to share the land with the Native Americans.

questions.question: How did the French and Indian War cause the American Revolution? (Choose 2)

choices.answer: The colonies seperated during the French and Indian War.
This is the first time the colonies united together to fight a common enemy
The F-I war caused Great Britain to go into debt and raised taxes
The French and Indian war provided Great Britain with a lot of wealth.

questions.question: What was the purpose of the Albany Plan of Union?

choices.answer: For colonies to unite under a central government and prepare for war
To plan an attack on Fort Duquesne.
For the British to join with the Native Americans against the French
For the New England colonies to unite with the Iroquois to fight the French

questions.question: The end of the French and Indian War affected the Native Americans in all of the following ways except...

choices.answer: Many English colonist were now going to move into their land
They were forced to move west of the Mississippi River.
They lost their trading partners, the French.
They were going to be treated as enemies by England and the colonists

questions.question: This Native American chief started a war to protect Native lands from English settlers

choices.answer: Chief Pontiac
Chief Tecumseh
Chief Powhatan
Chief Joseph

questions.question: Which answer best explains the meaning of this image?

choices.answer: The British colonies are like sneaky snakes and should be divided
The British colonies were actually divided into 10 different sections.
This image warns British colonists they must unite to defeat the French
This is how parts of a snake are labeled.

questions.question: In general, how did the colonists view the Proclamation of 1763?

choices.answer: They felt that it supported their freedom and they SUPPORTED it.
They felt it was an infringement on their freedom and were ANGRY
They supported it believing the King had the AUTHORITY to make the law
They were not involved so it did not affect them.
